algorithm_technique: Sort the array. Iterate through sorted beans, calculating the cost of making all remaining beans equal to the current bean's value.
problem_summary_simple: Minimize bean removal so all remaining non-empty bags have the same number of beans.
problem_summary_technical: Sort the beans. For each bean, calculate the cost of making all other beans equal to its value, considering the total beans removed.
key_insights: The problem can be reframed as choosing a target number of beans for all remaining bags.
Sorting the array allows us to efficiently calculate the cost for each potential target value.
The optimal strategy involves picking one of the existing bean counts as the target for all remaining bags.
